function.name: Notify_User
function.description: Send a message to the user without requiring a response. Used to confirm receipt, provide progress updates, or explain method changes.

attachment.description: (Optional) Attachments to show the user, such as file links, website links, etc. Enter as a list where each element is a string.

function.name: Ask_User
function.description: Send a message to the user that requires a response. Used to request clarification, ask for confirmation, or collect additional information.

attachment.description: (Optional) Attachments to show the user, such as file links, website links, etc. Enter as a list where each element is a string.

function.name: Read_File
function.description: Read file content. Used to view file contents, analyze logs, or read configuration files.

file_path.description: The file path, must be an absolute path (starting with /).

start_line.description: (Optional) The starting line number, beginning at 1.

end_line.description: (Optional) The ending line number, beginning at 1.

function.name: Write_File
function.description: Overwrite or append content to a file. Used to create new files, append content, or modify existing files.

file_path.description: The file path, must be an absolute path (starting with /).

append.description: (Optional) Whether to use append mode, default is false.

front_newline.description: (Optional) Whether to add a newline before the written content, default is false.

end_newline.description: (Optional) Whether to add a newline after the written content, default is false.

function.name: Send_Command
function.description: Execute a command in the specified shell session. Used to run code, install packages, or manage files. (If necessary, remember to prefix with sudo.)

terminal_id.description: (Required) The unique ID of the target terminal.

dir.description: The working directory where the command is executed, must be an absolute path (starting with /).

function.name: Send_Keys
function.description: Send keyboard input to a running process in the specified terminal. Used to interact with processes. (Avoid unless necessary.)

terminal_id.description: (Required) The unique ID of the target terminal.

end_newline.description: (Optional) Whether to add a newline after the input, default is false.

function.name: View_Terminal
function.description: View the output content of the specified terminal. Used to check command results or monitor output.

terminal_id.description: (Required) The unique ID of the target terminal.

function.name: Kill_Terminal
function.description: Terminate the process in the specified terminal. Used to stop long-running processes or handle stuck commands.

terminal_id.description: (Required) The unique ID of the target terminal.

function.name: idle
function.description: A special tool, indicating that you have completed all tasks and are about to enter a idle state.
